meanings.definition: A calcium-binding protein that regulates various cellular processes.
meanings.sent1: Calmodulin helps control important activities inside cells.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study calmodulin to understand how cells work.
meanings.sent3: The tiny calmodulin protein was like a conductor orchestrating the cell's activities.
meanings.sent4: In the busy city of the cell, calmodulin is the traffic cop directing all the movements.
meanings.sent5: Imagine calmodulin as a tiny superhero, swooping in to save the day by regulating cell functions.

meanings.definition: A protein that plays a key role in signal transduction.
meanings.sent1: When a signal needs to be passed along, calmodulin steps in to help.
meanings.sent2: Cells rely on calmodulin to transmit important messages.
meanings.sent3: Calmodulin was like the messenger delivering urgent news to the cell.
meanings.sent4: In the communication network of the cell, calmodulin acts as the crucial link.
meanings.sent5: Picture calmodulin as a swift courier ensuring signals reach their destinations accurately.
